isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Removal - Hydraulic Cam Followers

note.para: If it is necessary to remove the cam followers, the rear cover and the high-pressure oil pump cover must be removed to gain access to the rear branch tube assembly. Refer to the Rear Cover and High-pressure Oil Pump sections of this manual for correct procedures before proceeding.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, keep cam followers in the order they were removed. Install all cam followers back in their original positions.

note.para: As a general rule, hydraulic cam followers should not be serviced when they are functioning satisfactorily and operate quietly.

figure.caption: Removing the roller follower guide bolt / washer

note.para: Be careful when removing the mounting bolt / washer assembly used to secure roller follower guide to crankcase. These are small parts which can easily fall into the crankcase during removal.

step1.para: Remove one bolt / washer (M6 x 12) assembly from forward guide hole and lift out guide and roller lifters.

note.para: Identify location and orientation of each cam follower and guide during disassembly.

figure.caption: Removing the cam followers and roller follower guide

step1.para: Remove cam followers and roller follower guide by lifting the guide straight up. Some followers may need to be removed individually using hand tools.
Remove individual cam followers from roller follower guide.
